text: Ioannis (Yannis) Paschalidis (born 1968; Athens, Greece) is an electrical engineer, and professor.Ioannis Paschalidis Boston University. Retrieved December 1, 2019. He was born in Athens in 1968 and received a diploma degree from the National Technical University of Athens in 1991.biography Boston University. Retrieved December 1, 2019. He has an M.S. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from 1993, and a Ph.D. from 1996, both from Massachusetts Institute of Technology. His doctoral thesis was "Large Deviations in High-Speed Communication Networks" supervised by Dimitris Bertsimas and John Tsitsiklis. In September 1996, he joined Boston University College of Engineering and at some point in time, was appointed director for its Center for Information & Systems Engineering (CISE).Ioannis Paschalidis Center for Information & Systems. Retrieved December 1, 2019. He was named Fellow of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers in 2014, "for contributions to the control and optimization of communication and sensor networks, manufacturing systems, and biological systems". ==References== Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:Greek computer scientists Category:Greek electrical engineers Category:Massachusetts Institute of Technology alumni Category:Boston University faculty Category:Fellow Members of the IEEE Category:People from Athens
title: Ioannis Paschalidis
